contentrichtext.text: [[File:Marcus Samuel mw179354.jpg|200px|thumb|Lord Bearsted, ca. 1902.]] '''Viscount Bearsted''', of Maidstone in the County of Kent, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1925 for the businessman [[Marcus Samuel, 1st Viscount Bearsted|Marcus Samuel, 1st Baron Bearsted]], the joint-founder of the [[Royal Dutch Shell|Shell Transport and Trading Company]]. He had already been created a '''Baronet''' in the [[Baronetage of the United Kingdom]] in 1903 and '''Baron Bearsted''', of Maidstone in the County of Kent, in 1921, also in the Peerage of the United Kingdom. The titles descended from father to son until the death of his grandson, the third Viscount, in 1986. The late Viscount was succeeded by his younger brother, the fourth Viscount. {{As of|2012}} the titles are held by the latter's son, the fifth Viscount, who succeeded in 1996. ==Viscounts Bearsted (1925)== *[[Marcus Samuel, 1st Viscount Bearsted]] (1853–1927) *[[Walter Samuel, 2nd Viscount Bearsted|Walter Horace Samuel, 2nd Viscount Bearsted]] (1882–1948) *[[Marcus Samuel, 3rd Viscount Bearsted|Marcus Richard Samuel, 3rd Viscount Bearsted]] (1909–1986) *[[Peter Samuel, 4th Viscount Bearsted|Peter Montefiore Samuel, 4th Viscount Bearsted]] (1911–1996) *Nicholas Alan Samuel, 5th Viscount Bearsted (b. 1950) The [[heir apparent]] is the present holder's son the Hon. Harry Richard Samuel (b. 1988). ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990. *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} ==External links== *{{Hansard-contribs | mr-nicholas-samuel | Nicholas Alan Samuel, 5th Viscount Bearsted }} {{British viscounts}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bearsted, Viscount}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Viscountcies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
